game
Class Command


java.lang.Object

  game.Command
Direct Known Subclasses:
AutoCommand, ClearCommand, ClearToConnectCommand, DumpCommand, GameCommand, HelpCommand, HostCommand, JoinCommand, LoadCommand, ManualCommand, MoveCommand, NullCommand, QuitCommand, RemoteClearCommand, RemoteGameCommand, RemoteMoveCommand, RemoteQuitCommand, RemoteStartCommand, SeedCommand, StartCommand
abstract class Command
extends java.lang.Object

Command Parsing

A command represents a specific event, triggered by input from some source.
Commands have the ability to be executed, and the ability to be reported.
Upon execution, a command calls the required methods inside Game that corresponds with the event it represents.
Upon reporting, a command sends itself in the required format to the required players. This makes communication with a remote player or a local player mostly transparent from outside the command class - a beautiful advantage of OOP programming.

Error handling

Very little error handling occurs inside the Commands, since errors are normally generated either during execution/reporting, and these errors are simply passed through to executor of the command, and handled there.

Commands in effect at any moment

Different commands are in effect at different times (different states, modes and points of execution) and has different meaning according to the time and origin of the command. I make two major separations between the commands:
Commands from local players as represented by the remote*CommandTypes arrays of commands, and Remote*Command classes. This is NOT the commands that gets sent to remote players, simply the commands that is recognized * when deposited in the remote player's inbox.
Commands from remote players as represented by the *CommandTypes arrays of commands, and *Command classes.
Each possible command has a class, which is indexed in the appropriate array corresponding to its legality during eac state. This means that a command that might be legal during PLAYING (eg. move commands) will be signalled as an erroneous command simply by the fact that it is only manifested in the arrays corresponding to remote and local playing.

Commands

Remote commands come from remote players, other commands come from local players.

Source of commands in remote mode

The remote commands has an interesting twist in naming conventions. If you recieve a message from your Client player, that means that the HOST has sent it, and vice versa. Thus, often when giving user response, you would check that you have a host player and if you have report that the Client did something wrong. This is a simple matter of shifting the blame to those that are responsible for it.

remoteClientCommandTypes


static final Command[] remoteClientCommandTypes
Represents the legal commands recognized from (thus, the commands RECIEVED from) client players. Thus, this is the commands that is legal for host players to send to client players. This is NOT the commands that gets sent to remote players, simply the commands that is recognized when deposited in the remote player's inbox.

remoteHostCommandTypes


static final Command[] remoteHostCommandTypes
Represents the legal commands recognized from (thus, the commands RECIEVED from) host players. Thus, this is the commands that some other player can send to you when you are the host. This is NOT the commands that gets sent to remote players, simply the commands that is recognized when deposited in the remote player's inbox.

sentPlayer


Player sentPlayer

static final Command[] setupCommandTypes
Represents the legal commands recognized from the local player during the setup state.

waitingConnectionCommandTypes


static final Command[] waitingConnectionCommandTypes
This is the legal commands while the host player waits for a connection.

Constructor Detail

Method Detail

create


public static Command create(java.lang.String unparsedCommand,

                             Game game,

                             Player sentPlayer,

                             Player otherPlayer,

                             Color color)

                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
The Creation method for Commands. This method takes in all the required arguments to construct a command from a String containing a line representing a single command recieved from any type of player in any state or mode. It contains a decision making structure for the types of commands that is legal at this moment in time in the game (thus it looks at the type of player and the state of the game) and creates the required Command objects accordingly.

Parameters:
unparsedCommand - The string to be parsed. Assumed to be a full line from a player.
game - The current game being played.
sentPlayer - The player who issues this command.
otherPlayer - The other player in the game.
color - The color associated with this command.
Returns:
A command object that can execute the given string.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When the command in unrecognized.

execute


public abstract void execute()

                      throws java.io.IOException
Executes this command by calling the game class' method for this command.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

parse


public abstract Command parse(java.lang.String unparsedCommand,

                              Game game,

                              Player sentPlayer,

                              Player otherPlayer,

                              Color color)
Returns a specific class if the given argument is valid

report


public abstract void report()

                     throws java.io.IOException
Reports this comman to the players. This can involve printing a message to the terminal, displaying a message on the GUI, ignoring it or sending the message to the remote player, suitable modified. Assumes that the command is legal (it will not pass game's executor if it is not.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
